collection_readme.name: README.md
collection_readme.html:
f5networks.f5_modules

This collection includes the most recently released ansible modules for BIG-IP and BIG-IQ from F5Networks. This collection packages and distributes playbooks, roles, modules, and plugins.

Requirements

  • ansible >= 2.9

Installation

To install in ansible default or defined paths use:

ansible-galaxy collection install f5networks.f5_modules

To specify the installation location use -p. If specifying a folder, make sure to update the ansible.cfg so ansible will check this folder as well.

ansible-galaxy collection install f5networks.f5_modules -p collections/

To specify the version of the collection to install, include it at the end of the collection with :==1.0.0:

ansible-galaxy collection install f5networks.f5_modules:==1.0.0

Sematic Versioning examples below: - Increment major (for example: x in x.y.z) version number for an incompatible API change. - Increment minor (for example: y in x.y.z) version number for new functionality in a backwards compatible manner. - Increment patch (for example: z in x.y.z) version number for backwards compatible bug fixes.

Example Usage

To use a module from a collection, reference the full namespace, collection, and modules name that you want to use:

---
- name: Using Collections
  hosts: f5
  connection: local

  tasks:
    - f5networks.f5_modules.bigip_pool:
        name: my-pool
        ....

Author Information

F5 Networks F5 Networks

author: Tim Rupp (@caphrim007)
Greg Crosby (@crosbygw)
description: Manages BIG-IP LDAP monitors.
notes: For more information on using Ansible to manage F5 Networks devices see U(https://www.ansible.com/integrations/networks/f5).
Requires BIG-IP software version >= 12.

The F5 modules only manipulate the running configuration of the F5 product. To ensure that BIG-IP specific configuration persists to disk, be sure to include at least one task that uses the M(bigip_config) module to save the running configuration. Refer to the module's documentation for the correct usage of the module to save your running configuration.

options.name: base
description: Specifies the location in the LDAP tree from which the monitor starts the health check.

options.name: chase_referrals
description: Specifies whether, upon receipt of an LDAP referral entry, the target follows (or chases) that referral.

options.name: debug
description: Specifies whether the monitor sends error messages and additional information to a log file created and labeled specifically for this monitor.

options.name: description
description: Specifies descriptive text that identifies the monitor.

options.name: filter
description: Specifies an LDAP key for which the monitor searches.

options.name: interval
description: Specifies, in seconds, the frequency at which the system issues the monitor check when either the resource is down or the status of the resource is unknown.

options.name: ip
description: IP address part of the IP/port definition. If this parameter is not provided when creating a new monitor, then the default value will be '*'.

options.name: mandatory_attributes
description: Specifies whether the target must include attributes in its response to be considered up.

options.name: manual_resume
description: Specifies whether the system automatically changes the status of a resource to B(enabled) at the next successful monitor check.
If you set this option to C(yes), you must manually re-enable the resource before the system can use it for load balancing connections.
When C(yes), specifies that you must manually re-enable the resource after an unsuccessful monitor check.
When C(no), specifies that the system automatically changes the status of a resource to B(enabled) at the next successful monitor check.

options.name: name
description: Monitor name.

options.name: parent
description: The parent template of this monitor template. Once this value has been set, it cannot be changed.
By default, this value is the C(ldap) parent on the C(Common) partition.

options.name: partition
description: Device partition to manage resources on.

options.name: port
description: Port address part of the IP/port definition. If this parameter is not provided when creating a new monitor, then the default value will be '*'.
Note that if specifying an IP address, a value between 1 and 65535 must be specified.

options.name: provider
description: A dict object containing connection details.

suboptions.name: auth_provider
description: Configures the auth provider for to obtain authentication tokens from the remote device.
This option is really used when working with BIG-IQ devices.

suboptions.name: password
description: The password for the user account used to connect to the BIG-IP.
You may omit this option by setting the environment variable C(F5_PASSWORD).

suboptions.name: server
description: The BIG-IP host.
You may omit this option by setting the environment variable C(F5_SERVER).

suboptions.name: server_port
description: The BIG-IP server port.
You may omit this option by setting the environment variable C(F5_SERVER_PORT).

suboptions.name: ssh_keyfile
description: Specifies the SSH keyfile to use to authenticate the connection to the remote device.  This argument is only used for I(cli) transports.
You may omit this option by setting the environment variable C(ANSIBLE_NET_SSH_KEYFILE).

suboptions.name: timeout
description: Specifies the timeout in seconds for communicating with the network device for either connecting or sending commands.  If the timeout is exceeded before the operation is completed, the module will error.

suboptions.name: transport
description: Configures the transport connection to use when connecting to the remote device.

suboptions.name: user
description: The username to connect to the BIG-IP with. This user must have administrative privileges on the device.
You may omit this option by setting the environment variable C(F5_USER).

suboptions.name: validate_certs
description: If C(no), SSL certificates are not validated. Use this only on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates.
You may omit this option by setting the environment variable C(F5_VALIDATE_CERTS).

options.name: security
description: Specifies the secure protocol type for communications with the target.

options.name: state
description: When C(present), ensures that the monitor exists.
When C(absent), ensures the monitor is removed.

options.name: target_password
description: Specifies the password, if the monitored target requires authentication.

options.name: target_username
description: Specifies the user name, if the monitored target requires authentication.

options.name: time_until_up
description: Specifies the number of seconds to wait after a resource first responds correctly to the monitor before setting the resource to 'up'.
During the interval, all responses from the resource must be correct.
When the interval expires, the resource is marked 'up'.
A value of 0, means that the resource is marked up immediately upon receipt of the first correct response.

options.name: timeout
description: Specifies the number of seconds the target has in which to respond to the monitor request.

If the target responds within the set time period, it is considered 'up'. If the target does not respond within the set time period, it is considered 'down'. When this value is set to 0 (zero), the system uses the interval from the parent monitor.
Note that C(timeout) and C(time_until_up) combine to control when a resource is set to up.

options.name: up_interval
description: Specifies the interval for the system to use to perform the health check when a resource is up.
When C(0), specifies that the system uses the interval specified in C(interval) to check the health of the resource.
When any other number, enables specification of a different interval to use when checking the health of a resource that is up.

options.name: update_password
description: C(always) will update passwords if the C(target_password) is specified.
C(on_create) will only set the password for newly created monitors.

doc.short_description: Manages BIG-IP LDAP monitors

doc_strings.examples:
- name: Create a LDAP monitor
  bigip_monitor_ldap:
    name: foo
    provider:
      password: secret
      server: lb.mydomain.com
      user: admin
  delegate_to: localhost

return.name: base
return.description: The new LDAP Base setting of the resource.

return.name: chase_referrals
return.description: The new Chase Referrals setting of the resource.

return.name: debug
return.description: The new Debug setting of the resource.

return.name: description
return.description: The description of the monitor.

return.name: filter
return.description: The new LDAP Filter setting of the resource.

return.name: interval
return.description: The new interval in which to run the monitor check.

return.name: ip
return.description: The new IP of IP/port definition.

return.name: mandatory_attributes
return.description: The new Mandatory Attributes setting of the resource.

return.name: manual_resume
return.description: The new Manual Resume setting of the resource.

return.name: parent
return.description: New parent template of the monitor.

return.name: security
return.description: The new Security setting of the resource.

return.name: time_until_up
return.description: The new time in which to mark a system as up after first successful response.

return.name: timeout
return.description: The new timeout in which the remote system must respond to the monitor.

author: Tim Rupp (@caphrim007)
Wojciech Wypior (@wojtek0806)
description: Manage BIG-IP global settings.
notes: For more information on using Ansible to manage F5 Networks devices see U(https://www.ansible.com/integrations/networks/f5).
Requires BIG-IP software version >= 12.

The F5 modules only manipulate the running configuration of the F5 product. To ensure that BIG-IP specific configuration persists to disk, be sure to include at least one task that uses the M(bigip_config) module to save the running configuration. Refer to the module's documentation for the correct usage of the module to save your running configuration.

options.name: banner_text
description: Specifies the text to present in the advisory banner.

options.name: console_timeout
description: Specifies the number of seconds of inactivity before the system logs off a user that is logged on.

options.name: gui_setup
description: C(yes) or C(no) the Setup utility in the browser-based Configuration utility.

options.name: lcd_display
description: Specifies, when C(yes), that the system menu displays on the LCD screen on the front of the unit. This setting has no effect when used on the VE platform.

options.name: mgmt_dhcp
description: Specifies whether or not to enable DHCP client on the management interface

options.name: net_reboot
description: Specifies, when C(yes), that the next time you reboot the system, the system boots to an ISO image on the network, rather than an internal media drive.

options.name: provider
description: A dict object containing connection details.

suboptions.name: auth_provider
description: Configures the auth provider for to obtain authentication tokens from the remote device.
This option is really used when working with BIG-IQ devices.

suboptions.name: password
description: The password for the user account used to connect to the BIG-IP.
You may omit this option by setting the environment variable C(F5_PASSWORD).

suboptions.name: server
description: The BIG-IP host.
You may omit this option by setting the environment variable C(F5_SERVER).

suboptions.name: server_port
description: The BIG-IP server port.
You may omit this option by setting the environment variable C(F5_SERVER_PORT).

suboptions.name: ssh_keyfile
description: Specifies the SSH keyfile to use to authenticate the connection to the remote device.  This argument is only used for I(cli) transports.
You may omit this option by setting the environment variable C(ANSIBLE_NET_SSH_KEYFILE).

suboptions.name: timeout
description: Specifies the timeout in seconds for communicating with the network device for either connecting or sending commands.  If the timeout is exceeded before the operation is completed, the module will error.

suboptions.name: transport
description: Configures the transport connection to use when connecting to the remote device.

suboptions.name: user
description: The username to connect to the BIG-IP with. This user must have administrative privileges on the device.
You may omit this option by setting the environment variable C(F5_USER).

suboptions.name: validate_certs
description: If C(no), SSL certificates are not validated. Use this only on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates.
You may omit this option by setting the environment variable C(F5_VALIDATE_CERTS).

options.name: quiet_boot
description: Specifies, when C(yes), that the system suppresses informational text on the console during the boot cycle. When C(no), the system presents messages and informational text on the console during the boot cycle.

options.name: security_banner
description: Specifies whether the system displays an advisory message on the login screen.

options.name: state
description: The state of the variable on the system. When C(present), guarantees that an existing variable is set to C(value).

doc.short_description: Manage BIG-IP global settings

doc_strings.examples:
- name: Disable the setup utility
  bigip_sys_global:
    gui_setup: no
    provider:
      password: secret
      server: lb.mydomain.com
      user: admin
  delegate_to: localhost

return.name: banner_text
return.description: The new text to present in the advisory banner.
return.sample: This is a corporate device. Do not touch.

return.name: console_timeout
description: The new number of seconds of inactivity before the system logs off a user that is logged on.

return.name: gui_setup
return.description: The new setting for the Setup utility.

return.name: lcd_display
return.description: The new setting for displaying the system menu on the LCD.

return.name: mgmt_dhcp
return.description: The new setting for whether the mgmt interface should DHCP or not.

return.name: net_reboot
return.description: The new setting for whether the system should boot to an ISO on the network or not.

return.name: quiet_boot
description: The new setting for whether the system should suppress information to the console during boot or not.

return.name: security_banner
description: The new setting for whether the system should display an advisory message on the login screen or not.

author: Tim Rupp (@caphrim007)
description: Manages BIG-IQ applications used for load balancing an HTTP application on port 80 on BIG-IP.
notes: This module does not support updating of your application (whether deployed or not). If you need to update the application, the recommended practice is to remove and re-create.
This module will not work on BIGIQ version 6.1.x or greater.
For more information on using Ansible to manage F5 Networks devices see U(https://www.ansible.com/integrations/networks/f5).
Requires BIG-IP software version >= 12.

The F5 modules only manipulate the running configuration of the F5 product. To ensure that BIG-IP specific configuration persists to disk, be sure to include at least one task that uses the M(bigip_config) module to save the running configuration. Refer to the module's documentation for the correct usage of the module to save your running configuration.

options.name: add_analytics
description: Collects statistics of the BIG-IP that the application is deployed to.
This parameter is only relevant when specifying a C(service_environment) which is a BIG-IP; not an SSG.

options.name: description
description: Description of the application.

options.name: inbound_virtual
description: Settings to configure the virtual which will receive the inbound connection.
This virtual will be used to host the HTTP endpoint of the application.

suboptions.name: address
description: Specifies destination IP address information to which the virtual server sends traffic.
This parameter is required when creating a new application.

suboptions.name: netmask
description: Specifies the netmask to associate with the given C(destination).
This parameter is required when creating a new application.

suboptions.name: port
description: The port that the virtual listens for connections on.
When creating a new application, if this parameter is not specified, the default value of C(80) will be used.

options.name: name
description: Name of the new application.

options.name: provider
description: A dict object containing connection details.

suboptions.name: auth_provider
description: Configures the auth provider for to obtain authentication tokens from the remote device.
This option is really used when working with BIG-IQ devices.

suboptions.name: password
description: The password for the user account used to connect to the BIG-IP.
You may omit this option by setting the environment variable C(F5_PASSWORD).

suboptions.name: server
description: The BIG-IP host.
You may omit this option by setting the environment variable C(F5_SERVER).

suboptions.name: server_port
description: The BIG-IP server port.
You may omit this option by setting the environment variable C(F5_SERVER_PORT).

suboptions.name: ssh_keyfile
description: Specifies the SSH keyfile to use to authenticate the connection to the remote device.  This argument is only used for I(cli) transports.
You may omit this option by setting the environment variable C(ANSIBLE_NET_SSH_KEYFILE).

suboptions.name: timeout
description: Specifies the timeout in seconds for communicating with the network device for either connecting or sending commands.  If the timeout is exceeded before the operation is completed, the module will error.

suboptions.name: transport
description: Configures the transport connection to use when connecting to the remote device.

suboptions.name: user
description: The username to connect to the BIG-IP with. This user must have administrative privileges on the device.
You may omit this option by setting the environment variable C(F5_USER).

suboptions.name: validate_certs
description: If C(no), SSL certificates are not validated. Use this only on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates.
You may omit this option by setting the environment variable C(F5_VALIDATE_CERTS).

options.name: servers
description: A list of servers that the application is hosted on.
If you are familiar with other BIG-IP setting, you might also refer to this list as the list of pool members.
When creating a new application, at least one server is required.

suboptions.name: address
description: The IP address of the server.

suboptions.name: port
description: The port of the server.
When creating a new application and specifying a server, if this parameter is not provided, the default of C(80) will be used.

options.name: service_environment
description: Specifies the name of service environment that the application will be deployed to.
When creating a new application, this parameter is required.

The service environment type will be discovered by this module automatically. Therefore, it is crucial that you maintain unique names for items in the different service environment types (at this time, SSGs and BIGIPs).

options.name: state
description: The state of the resource on the system.
When C(present), guarantees that the resource exists with the provided attributes.
When C(absent), removes the resource from the system.

options.name: wait
description: If the module should wait for the application to be created, deleted or updated.

doc.short_description: Manages BIG-IQ HTTP applications

doc_strings.examples:
- name: Load balance an HTTP application on port 80 on BIG-IP
  bigiq_application_http:
    name: my-app
    description: Redirect HTTP to HTTPS
    service_environment: my-ssg
    servers:
      - address: 1.2.3.4
        port: 8080
      - address: 5.6.7.8
        port: 8080
    inbound_virtual:
      name: foo
      address: 2.2.2.2
      netmask: 255.255.255.255
      port: 443
    provider:
      password: secret
      server: lb.mydomain.com
      user: admin
    state: present
  delegate_to: localhost

return.name: description
return.description: The new description of the application of the resource.

return.name: inbound_virtual_destination
return.description: The destination of the virtual that was created.

return.name: inbound_virtual_netmask
return.description: The network mask of the provided inbound destination.

return.name: inbound_virtual_port
return.description: The port the inbound virtual address listens on.

return.name: servers

contains.name: address
contains.description: The IP address of the server.

contains.name: port
contains.description: The port that the server listens on.

return.description: List of servers, and their ports, that make up the application.

return.name: service_environment
return.description: The environment which the service was deployed to.

author: Wojciech Wypior (@wojtek0806)
description: Manage BIG-IP ASM policies, create from templates and manage global policy settings.
notes: For more information on using Ansible to manage F5 Networks devices see U(https://www.ansible.com/integrations/networks/f5).
Requires BIG-IP software version >= 12.

The F5 modules only manipulate the running configuration of the F5 product. To ensure that BIG-IP specific configuration persists to disk, be sure to include at least one task that uses the M(bigip_config) module to save the running configuration. Refer to the module's documentation for the correct usage of the module to save your running configuration.

options.name: active
description: If C(yes) will apply and activate existing inactive policy. If C(no), it will deactivate existing active policy. Generally should be C(yes) only in cases where you want to activate new or existing policy.

options.name: name
description: The ASM policy to manage or create.

options.name: partition
description: Device partition to manage resources on.

options.name: provider
description: A dict object containing connection details.

suboptions.name: auth_provider
description: Configures the auth provider for to obtain authentication tokens from the remote device.
This option is really used when working with BIG-IQ devices.

suboptions.name: password
description: The password for the user account used to connect to the BIG-IP.
You may omit this option by setting the environment variable C(F5_PASSWORD).

suboptions.name: server
description: The BIG-IP host.
You may omit this option by setting the environment variable C(F5_SERVER).

suboptions.name: server_port
description: The BIG-IP server port.
You may omit this option by setting the environment variable C(F5_SERVER_PORT).

suboptions.name: ssh_keyfile
description: Specifies the SSH keyfile to use to authenticate the connection to the remote device.  This argument is only used for I(cli) transports.
You may omit this option by setting the environment variable C(ANSIBLE_NET_SSH_KEYFILE).

suboptions.name: timeout
description: Specifies the timeout in seconds for communicating with the network device for either connecting or sending commands.  If the timeout is exceeded before the operation is completed, the module will error.

suboptions.name: transport
description: Configures the transport connection to use when connecting to the remote device.

suboptions.name: user
description: The username to connect to the BIG-IP with. This user must have administrative privileges on the device.
You may omit this option by setting the environment variable C(F5_USER).

suboptions.name: validate_certs
description: If C(no), SSL certificates are not validated. Use this only on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates.
You may omit this option by setting the environment variable C(F5_VALIDATE_CERTS).

options.name: state
description: When C(state) is C(present), and C(template) parameter is provided, new ASM policy is created from template with the given policy C(name).
When C(state) is present and no C(template) parameter is provided new blank ASM policy is created with the given policy C(name).
When C(state) is C(absent), ensures that the policy is removed, even if it is currently active.

options.name: template
description: An ASM policy built-in template. If the template does not exist we will raise an error.
Once the policy has been created, this value cannot change.
The C(Comprehensive), C(Drupal), C(Fundamental), C(Joomla), C(Vulnerability Assessment Baseline), and C(Wordpress) templates are only available on BIG-IP versions >= 13.

doc.short_description: Manage BIG-IP ASM policies

doc_strings.examples:
- name: Create ASM policy from template
  bigip_asm_policy:
    name: new_sharepoint_policy
    template: SharePoint 2007 (http)
    state: present
    provider:
      server: lb.mydomain.com
      user: admin
      password: secret
  delegate_to: localhost

- name: Create blank ASM policy
  bigip_asm_policy:
    name: new_blank_policy
    state: present
    provider:
      server: lb.mydomain.com
      user: admin
      password: secret
  delegate_to: localhost

- name: Create blank ASM policy and activate
  bigip_asm_policy:
    name: new_blank_policy
    active: yes
    state: present
    provider:
      server: lb.mydomain.com
      user: admin
      password: secret
  delegate_to: localhost

- name: Activate ASM policy
  bigip_asm_policy:
    name: inactive_policy
    active: yes
    state: present
    provider:
      server: lb.mydomain.com
      user: admin
      password: secret
  delegate_to: localhost

- name: Deactivate ASM policy
  bigip_asm_policy_manage:
    name: active_policy
    state: present
    provider:
      server: lb.mydomain.com
      user: admin
      password: secret
  delegate_to: localhost

return.name: active
return.description: Set when activating/deactivating ASM policy

return.name: name
return.description: Name of the ASM policy to be managed/created

return.name: state
return.description: Action performed on the target device.

return.name: template
return.description: Name of the built-in ASM policy template

author: Wojciech Wypior (@wojtek0806)
description: Manages Server Technology on ASM policy.
notes: This module is primarily used as a component of configuring ASM policy in Ansible Galaxy ASM Policy Role.

options.name: partition

options.name: policy_name

suboptions.name: validate_certs

You may omit this option by setting the environment variable C(F5_VALIDATE_CERTS).

options.name: state
description: When C(present), ensures that the resource exists.
When C(absent), ensures the resource is removed.

doc.short_description: Manages Server Technology on ASM policy

doc_strings.examples:
- name: Add Server Technology to ASM Policy
  bigip_asm_policy_server_technology:
    name: Joomla
    policy_name: FooPolicy
    provider:
      password: secret
      server: lb.mydomain.com
      user: admin
  delegate_to: localhost
- name: Remove Server Technology from ASM Policy
  bigip_asm_policy_server_technology:
    name: Joomla
    policy_name: FooPolicy
    state: absent
    provider:
      password: secret
      server: lb.mydomain.com
      user: admin
  delegate_to: localhost

return.name: name
return.description: The name of Server Technology added/removed on ASM policy

return.name: policy_name
return.description: The name of the ASM policy

author: Tim Rupp (@caphrim007)
Wojciech Wypior (@wojtek0806)
description: Manage BIG-IP partitions.
notes: Requires BIG-IP software version >= 12
For more information on using Ansible to manage F5 Networks devices see U(https://www.ansible.com/integrations/networks/f5).

options.name: provider

suboptions.name: auth_provider

suboptions.name: password
