contains.name: comment
description: User comments about the device.

contains.name: configsync_address
description: IP address used for configuration synchronization.

contains.name: contact
description: Administrator contact information.

contains.name: description
description: Description of the device.

contains.name: edition
description: Displays the software edition.

contains.name: failover_state
description: Device failover state.

contains.name: full_path
description: Full name of the resource as known to BIG-IP.

contains.name: hostname
description: Device hostname

contains.name: location
description: Specifies the physical location of the device.

contains.name: management_address
description: IP address of the management interface.

contains.name: marketing_name
description: Marketing name of the device platform.

contains.name: multicast_address
description: Specifies the multicast IP address used for failover.

contains.name: name
description: Relative name of the resource in BIG-IP.

contains.name: optional_modules
description: Modules that are available for the current platform, but are not currently licensed.

contains.name: platform_id
description: Displays the device platform identifier.

contains.name: primary_mirror_address
description: Specifies the IP address used for state mirroring.

contains.name: product
description: Displays the software product name.

contains.name: secondary_mirror_address
description: Secondary IP address used for state mirroring.

contains.name: self
description: Whether this device is the one that was queried for information, or not.

contains.name: software_version
description: Displays the software version number.

contains.name: timelimited_modules
description: Displays the licensed modules that are time-limited.

contains.name: timezone
description: Displays the time zone configured on the device.

contains.name: unicast_addresses
effective_ip
description: The IP address that peers can use to reach this unicast address IP.

contains.name: effective_port
description: The port that peers can use to reach this unicast address.

contains.name: ip
description: The IP address that the failover daemon will listen on for packets from its peers.

contains.name: port
description: The IP port that the failover daemon uses to accept packets from its peers.
Specifies the entire set of unicast addresses used for failover.

return.description: Device related information.
return.returned: When C(devices) is specified in C(gather_subset).

return.name: external_monitors

contains.name: args
description: Specifies any command-line arguments that the script requires.

contains.name: description
description: Description of the resource.

contains.name: destination
description: Specifies the IP address and service port of the resource that is the destination of this monitor.

contains.name: external_program
description: Specifies the name of the file for the monitor to use.

contains.name: full_path
description: Full name of the resource as known to BIG-IP.

contains.name: interval
description: Specifies, in seconds, the frequency at which the system issues the monitor check when either the resource is down or the status of the resource is unknown.

contains.name: manual_resume
description: Specifies whether the system automatically changes the status of a resource to up at the next successful monitor check.

contains.name: name
description: Relative name of the resource in BIG-IP.

contains.name: parent
description: Profile from which this profile inherits settings.

contains.name: time_until_up
description: Specifies the amount of time, in seconds, after the first successful response before a node is marked up.

contains.name: timeout
description: Specifies the number of seconds the target has in which to respond to the monitor request.

contains.name: up_interval
description: Specifies, in seconds, the frequency at which the system issues the monitor check when the resource is up.

contains.name: variables
description: Specifies any variables that the script requires.

return.description: External monitor related information.
return.returned: When C(external-monitors) is specified in C(gather_subset).

return.name: fasthttp_profiles

contains.name: client_close_timeout
description: Number of seconds after which the system closes a client connection, when the system either receives a client FIN packet or sends a FIN packet to the client.

contains.name: description
description: Description of the resource.

contains.name: force_http_1_0_response
description: Specifies, when C(yes), that the server sends responses to clients in the HTTP/1.0 format.

contains.name: full_path
description: Full name of the resource as known to BIG-IP.

contains.name: http_1_1_close_workarounds
description: Specifies, when C(yes), that the server uses workarounds for HTTP 1.1 close issues.

contains.name: idle_timeout
description: Length of time that a connection is idle (has no traffic) before the connection is eligible for deletion.

contains.name: insert_x_forwarded_for
description: Whether the system inserts the X-Forwarded-For header in an HTTP request with the client IP address, to use with connection pooling.

contains.name: maximum_header_size
description: Maximum amount of HTTP header data that the system buffers before making a load balancing decision.

contains.name: maximum_requests
description: Maximum number of requests that the system can receive on a client-side connection, before the system closes the connection.

contains.name: maximum_segment_size_override
description: Maximum segment size (MSS) override for server-side connections.

contains.name: name
description: Relative name of the resource in BIG-IP.

contains.name: oneconnect_idle_timeout_override
description: Number of seconds after which a server-side connection in a OneConnect pool is eligible for deletion, when the connection has no traffic.

contains.name: oneconnect_maximum_pool_size
description: Maximum number of connections to a load balancing pool.

contains.name: oneconnect_maximum_reuse
description: Maximum number of times that the system can re-use a current connection.

contains.name: oneconnect_minimum_pool_size
description: Minimum number of connections to a load balancing pool.

contains.name: oneconnect_ramp_up_increment
description: The increment in which the system makes additional connections available, when all available connections are in use.

contains.name: oneconnect_replenish'
description: Specifies, when C(yes), that the system will not keep a steady-state maximum of connections to the back-end unless the number of connections to the pool have dropped beneath the C(minimum_pool_size) specified in the profile.

contains.name: parent
description: Profile from which this profile inherits settings.

contains.name: receive_window_size
description: Amount of data the BIG-IP system can accept without acknowledging the server.

contains.name: request_header_insert
description: A string that the system inserts as a header in an HTTP request. If the header exists already, the system does not replace it.

contains.name: reset_on_timeout
description: Specifies, when C(yes), that the system sends a reset packet (RST) in addition to deleting the connection, when a connection exceeds the idle timeout value.

contains.name: server_close_timeout
description: Number of seconds after which the system closes a client connection, when the system either receives a server FIN packet or sends a FIN packet to the server.

contains.name: server_sack
description: Whether the BIG-IP system processes Selective ACK (Sack) packets in cookie responses from the server.

contains.name: server_timestamp
description: Whether the BIG-IP system processes timestamp request packets in cookie responses from the server.

contains.name: unclean_shutdown
description: How the system handles closing connections. Values provided may be C(enabled), C(disabled), or C(fast).

return.description: FastHTTP profile related information.
return.returned: When C(fasthttp-profiles) is specified in C(gather_subset).

return.name: fastl4_profiles

contains.name: client_timeout
description: Specifies late binding client timeout in seconds.
This is the number of seconds allowed for a client to transmit enough data to select a server pool.
If this timeout expires, the timeout-recovery option dictates whether to drop the connection or fallback to the normal FastL4 load-balancing method to pick a server pool.

contains.name: description
description: Description of the resource.

contains.name: dont_fragment_flag
description: Describes the Don't Fragment (DF) bit setting in the IP Header of the outgoing TCP packet.
When C(pmtu), sets the outgoing IP Header DF bit based on IP pmtu setting(tm.pathmtudiscovery).
When C(preserve), sets the outgoing Packet's IP Header DF bit to be same as incoming IP Header DF bit.
When C(set), sets the outgoing packet's IP Header DF bit.
When C(clear), clears the outgoing packet's IP Header DF bit.

contains.name: explicit_flow_migration
description: Specifies whether to have the iRule code determine exactly when the FIX stream drops down to the ePVA hardware.

contains.name: full_path
description: Full name of the resource as known to BIG-IP.

contains.name: generate_init_seq_number
description: Specifies whether you want to generate TCP sequence numbers on all SYNs that conform with RFC1948, and allow timestamp recycling.

contains.name: hardware_syn_cookie
description: Enables or disables hardware SYN cookie support when PVA10 is present on the system.
This option is deprecated in version 13.0.0 and is replaced by C(syn-cookie-enable).

contains.name: idle_timeout
description: Specifies the number of seconds that a connection is idle before the connection is eligible for deletion.
Values will be in the range of 0 to 4294967295 (inclusive).
C(0) is equivalent to the TMUI value "immediate".
C(4294967295) is equivalent to the TMUI value "indefinite".

contains.name: ip_tos_to_client
description: Specifies an IP Type of Service (ToS) number for the client-side.
This option specifies the ToS level that the traffic management system assigns to IP packets when sending them to clients.

contains.name: ip_tos_to_server
description: Specifies an IP ToS number for the server side.
This option specifies the ToS level that the traffic management system assigns to IP packets when sending them to servers.

contains.name: keep_alive_interval
description: Specifies the keep-alive probe interval, in seconds.
A value of 0 indicates keep-alive is disabled.

contains.name: late_binding
description: Specifies whether to enable or disable intelligent selection of a back-end server pool.

contains.name: link_qos_to_client
description: Specifies a Link Quality of Service (QoS) (VLAN priority) number for the client side.
This option specifies the QoS level that the system assigns to packets when sending them to clients.

contains.name: link_qos_to_server
description: Specifies a Link QoS (VLAN priority) number for the server side.
This option specifies the QoS level that the system assigns to packets when sending them to servers.

contains.name: loose_close
description: Specifies that the system closes a loosely-initiated connection when the system receives the first FIN packet from either the client or the server.

contains.name: loose_init
description: Specifies that the system initializes a connection when it receives any Transmission Control Protocol (TCP) packet, rather than requiring a SYN packet for connection initiation.

contains.name: mss_override
description: Specifies a maximum segment size (MSS) override for server connections. Note that this is also the MSS advertised to a client when a client first connects.
C(0) (zero), means the option is disabled. Otherwise, the value will be between 256 and 9162.

contains.name: name
description: Relative name of the resource in BIG-IP.

contains.name: parent
description: Profile from which this profile inherits settings.

contains.name: priority_to_client
description: Specifies internal packet priority for the client side.
This option specifies the internal packet priority that the system assigns to packets when sending them to clients.

contains.name: priority_to_server
description: Specifies internal packet priority for the server side.
This option specifies the internal packet priority that the system assigns to packets when sending them to servers.

contains.name: pva_acceleration
description: Specifies the Packet Velocity(r) ASIC acceleration policy.

contains.name: pva_dynamic_client_packets
description: Specifies the number of client packets before dynamic ePVA hardware re-offloading occurs.
Values will be between 0 and 10.

contains.name: pva_dynamic_server_packets
description: Specifies the number of server packets before dynamic ePVA hardware re-offloading occurs.
Values will be between 0 and 10.

contains.name: pva_flow_aging
description: Specifies if automatic aging from ePVA flow cache is enabled or not.

contains.name: pva_flow_evict
description: Specifies if this flow can be evicted upon hash collision with a new flow learn snoop request.

contains.name: pva_offload_dynamic
description: Specifies whether PVA flow dynamic offloading is enabled or not.

contains.name: pva_offload_state
description: Specifies at what stage the ePVA performs hardware offload.
When C(embryonic), implies at TCP CSYN or the first client UDP packet.
When C(establish), implies TCP 3WAY handshaking or UDP CS round trip are confirmed.

contains.name: reassemble_fragments
description: Specifies whether to reassemble fragments.

contains.name: receive_window
description: Specifies the window size to use, in bytes.
The maximum is 2^31 for window scale enabling.

contains.name: reset_on_timeout
description: Specifies whether you want to reset connections on timeout.

contains.name: rtt_from_client
description: Enables or disables the TCP timestamp options to measure the round trip time to the client.

contains.name: rtt_from_server
description: Enables or disables the TCP timestamp options to measure the round trip time to the server.

contains.name: server_sack
description: Specifies whether to support server sack option in cookie response by default.

contains.name: server_timestamp
description: Specifies whether to support server timestamp option in cookie response by default.

contains.name: software_syn_cookie
description: Enables or disables software SYN cookie support when PVA10 is not present on the system.
This option is deprecated in version 13.0.0 and is replaced by C(syn_cookie_enabled).

contains.name: strip_sack
description: Specifies whether you want to block the TCP SackOK option from passing to the server on an initiating SYN.

contains.name: syn_cookie_enabled
description: Enables syn-cookies capability on this virtual server.

contains.name: syn_cookie_mss
description: Specifies a maximum segment size (MSS) for server connections when SYN Cookie is enabled.

contains.name: syn_cookie_whitelist
description: Specifies whether or not to use a SYN Cookie WhiteList when doing software SYN Cookies.

contains.name: tcp_close_timeout
description: Specifies a TCP close timeout in seconds.

contains.name: tcp_handshake_timeout
description: Specifies a TCP handshake timeout in seconds.

contains.name: tcp_time_wait_timeout
description: Specifies a TCP time_wait timeout in milliseconds.

contains.name: tcp_timestamp_mode
description: Specifies how you want to handle the TCP timestamp.

contains.name: tcp_window_scale_mode
description: Specifies how you want to handle the TCP window scale.

contains.name: timeout_recovery
description: Specifies late binding timeout recovery mode. This is the action to take when late binding timeout occurs on a connection.
When C(disconnect), only the L7 iRule actions are acceptable to pick a server.
When C(fallback), the normal FastL4 load-balancing methods are acceptable to pick a server.

contains.name: ttl_mode
description: Describe the outgoing TCP packet's IP Header TTL mode.
When C(proxy), sets the outgoing IP Header TTL value to 255/64 for ipv4/ipv6 respectively.
When C(preserve), sets the outgoing IP Header TTL value to be same as the incoming IP Header TTL value.
When C(decrement), sets the outgoing IP Header TTL value to be one less than the incoming TTL value.
When C(set), sets the outgoing IP Header TTL value to a specific value(as specified by C(ttl_v4) or C(ttl_v6).

contains.name: ttl_v4
description: Specify the outgoing packet's IP Header TTL value for IPv4 traffic.
Maximum value that can be specified is 255.

contains.name: ttl_v6
description: Specify the outgoing packet's IP Header TTL value for IPv6 traffic.
Maximum value that can be specified is 255.

return.description: FastL4 profile related information.
return.returned: When C(fastl4-profiles) is specified in C(gather_subset).

return.name: gateway_icmp_monitors

contains.name: adaptive
description: Whether adaptive response time monitoring is enabled for this monitor.

contains.name: adaptive_divergence_type
description: Specifies whether the adaptive-divergence-value is C(relative) or C(absolute).

contains.name: adaptive_divergence_value
description: Specifies how far from mean latency each monitor probe is allowed to be.

contains.name: adaptive_limit
description: Specifies the hard limit, in milliseconds, which the probe is not allowed to exceed, regardless of the divergence value.

contains.name: adaptive_sampling_timespan
description: Specifies the size of the sliding window, in seconds, which records probe history.

contains.name: description
description: Description of the resource.

contains.name: destination
description: Specifies the IP address and service port of the resource that is the destination of this monitor.

contains.name: full_path
description: Full name of the resource as known to BIG-IP.

contains.name: interval
description: Specifies, in seconds, the frequency at which the system issues the monitor check when either the resource is down or the status of the resource is unknown.

contains.name: manual_resume
description: Specifies whether the system automatically changes the status of a resource to up at the next successful monitor check.

contains.name: name
description: Relative name of the resource in BIG-IP.

contains.name: parent
description: Profile from which this profile inherits settings.

contains.name: time_until_up
description: Specifies the amount of time, in seconds, after the first successful response before a node is marked up.

contains.name: timeout
description: Specifies the number of seconds the target has in which to respond to the monitor request.

contains.name: transparent
description: Specifies whether the monitor operates in transparent mode.

contains.name: up_interval
description: Specifies, in seconds, the frequency at which the system issues the monitor check when the resource is up.

return.description: Gateway ICMP monitor related information.
return.returned: When C(gateway-icmp-monitors) is specified in C(gather_subset).

return.name: gtm_pools

contains.name: alternate_mode
description: The load balancing mode that the system uses to load balance name resolution requests among the members of the pool.

contains.name: disabled
description: Is the pool disabled.

contains.name: dynamic_ratio
description: Whether or not the dynamic ratio load balancing algorithm is enabled for this pool.

contains.name: enabled
description: Is the pool enabled.

contains.name: fallback_mode
description: Specifies the load balancing mode that the system uses to load balance name resolution amongst the pool members if the preferred and alternate modes are unsuccessful in picking a pool.

contains.name: full_path
description: Full name of the resource as known to BIG-IP.

contains.name: load_balancing_mode
description: Specifies the preferred load balancing mode that the system uses to load balance requests across pool members.

contains.name: manual_resume
description: Whether manual resume is enabled for this pool.

contains.name: max_answers_returned
description: Maximum number of available virtual servers that the system lists in a response.

contains.name: members
description: Lists of members (and their configurations) in the pool.

contains.name: name
description: Relative name of the resource in BIG-IP.

contains.name: partition
description: Partition the pool exists on.

contains.name: qos_hit_ratio
description: Weight of the Hit Ratio performance factor for the QoS dynamic load balancing method.

contains.name: qos_hops
description: Weight of the Hops performance factor when load balancing mode or fallback mode is QoS.

contains.name: qos_kilobytes_second
description: Weight assigned to Kilobytes per Second performance factor when load balancing option is QoS.

contains.name: qos_lcs
description: Weight assign to the Link Capacity performance factor when load balacing option is QoS.

contains.name: qos_packet_rate
description: Weight assign to the Packet Rate performance factor when load balacing option is QoS.

contains.name: qos_rtt
description: Weight assign to the Round Trip Time performance factor when load balacing option is QoS.

contains.name: qos_topology
description: Weight assign to the Topology performance factor when load balacing option is QoS.

contains.name: qos_vs_capacity
description: Weight assign to the Virtual Server performance factor when load balacing option is QoS.

contains.name: qos_vs_score
description: Weight assign to the Virtual Server Score performance factor when load balacing option is QoS.

contains.name: ttl
description: Number of seconds that the IP address, once found, is valid.

contains.name: verify_member_availability
description: Whether or not the system verifies the availability of the members before sending a connection to them.
GTM pool related information.
Every "type" of pool has the exact same list of possible information. Therefore, the list of information here is presented once instead of 6 times.
return.returned: When any of C(gtm-pools) or C(gtm-*-pools) is specified in C(gather_subset).

return.name: gtm_servers

contains.name: addresses
description: Specifies the server IP addresses for the server.

contains.name: datacenter
description: Full name of the datacenter this server belongs to.

contains.name: devices
description: Specifies the names of the devices that represent this server.

contains.name: disabled
description: Whether the server is disabled.

contains.name: enabled
description: Whether the server is enabled.

contains.name: expose_route_domains
description: Allow the GTM server to auto-discover the LTM virtual servers from all route domains.

contains.name: full_path
description: Full name of the resource as known to BIG-IP.

contains.name: iq_allow_path
description: Whether the GTM uses this BIG-IP system to conduct a path probe before delegating traffic to it.

contains.name: iq_allow_service_check
description: Whether the GTM uses this BIG-IP system to conduct a service check probe before delegating traffic to it.

contains.name: iq_allow_snmp
description: Whether the GTM uses this BIG-IP system to conduct an SNMP probe before delegating traffic to it.

contains.name: limit_cpu_usage
description: For a server configured as a generic host, specifies the percent of CPU usage, otherwise has no effect.

contains.name: limit_cpu_usage_status
description: Whether C(limit_cpu_usage) is enabled for this server.

contains.name: limit_max_bps
description: Maximum allowable data throughput rate in bits per second for this server.

contains.name: limit_max_bps_status
description: Whether C(limit_max_bps) is enabled for this server.

contains.name: limit_max_connections
description: Maximum number of concurrent connections, combined, for this server.

contains.name: limit_max_connections_status
description: Whether C(limit_max_connections) is enabled for this server.

contains.name: limit_max_pps
description: Maximum allowable data transfer rate, in packets per second, for this server.

contains.name: limit_max_pps_status
description: Whether C(limit_max_pps) is enabled for this server.

contains.name: limit_mem_available
description: For a server configured as a generic host, specifies the available memory required by the virtual servers on the server.
If available memory falls below this limit, the system marks the server as unavailable.

contains.name: limit_mem_available_status
description: Whether C(limit_mem_available) is enabled for this server.

contains.name: link_discovery
description: Specifies whether the system auto-discovers the links for this server.

contains.name: monitor_type
description: Whether one or monitors need to pass, or all monitors need to pass.

contains.name: monitors
description: Specifies health monitors that the system uses to determine whether this server is available for load balancing.

contains.name: name
description: Relative name of the resource in BIG-IP.

contains.name: prober_fallback
description: The type of prober to use to monitor this servers resources when the preferred type is not available.

contains.name: prober_preference
description: Specifies the type of prober to use to monitor this servers resources.

contains.name: product
description: Specifies the server type.

contains.name: virtual_server_discovery
description: Whether the system auto-discovers the virtual servers for this server.

contains.name: virtual_servers
description: Virtual servers that are resources for this server.
GTM server related information.
return.returned: When C(gtm-servers) is specified in C(gather_subset).

return.name: gtm_topology_regions

contains.name: full_path
description: Full name of the resource as known to BIG-IP.

contains.name: name
description: Relative name of the resource in BIG-IP.

contains.name: region_members
continent
description: The name of one of the seven continents in ISO format, along with the C(Unknown) setting.
contains.returned: when configured for the region member.

contains.name: country
description: The country name returned as an ISO country code.
Valid country codes can be found here https://countrycode.org/.
contains.returned: when configured for the region member.

contains.name: datacenter
description: The name of GTM data center already defined in the configuration.
contains.returned: when configured for the region member.

contains.name: geo_isp
description: Specifies a geolocation ISP
contains.returned: when configured for the region member.

contains.name: isp
description: Specifies an Internet service provider.
contains.returned: when configured for the region member.

contains.name: negate
description: Indicates if region member is a C(IS-NOT) negative. In BIG-IP configuration the region members can be C(IS) or C(IS-NOT).
contains.returned: when configured for the region member.

contains.name: pool
description: The name of GTM pool already defined in the configuration.
contains.returned: when configured for the region member.

contains.name: region
description: The name of region already defined in the configuration.
contains.returned: when configured for the region member.

contains.name: state
description: The state in a given country.
contains.returned: when configured for the region member.

contains.name: subnet
description: An IP address and network mask in the CIDR format.
contains.returned: when configured for the region member.

description: The list of region members.

return.description: GTM regions related information.
return.returned: When C(gtm-topology-regions) is specified in C(gather_subset)

return.name: gtm_wide_ips

contains.name: description
description: Description of the wide ip.

contains.name: disabled
description: Whether the Wide IP is disabled.

contains.name: enabled
description: Whether the Wide IP is enabled.

contains.name: failure_rcode
description: Specifies the DNS RCODE used when C(failure_rcode_response) is C(yes).

contains.name: failure_rcode_response
description: When C(yes), specifies that the system returns a RCODE response to Wide IP requests after exhausting all load-balancing methods.

contains.name: failure_rcode_ttl
description: Specifies the negative caching TTL of the SOA for the RCODE response.

contains.name: full_path
description: Full name of the resource as known to BIG-IP.

contains.name: last_resort_pool
description: Specifies which pool, as listed in Pool List, for the system to use as the last resort pool for the wide IP.

contains.name: minimal_response
description: Specifies that the system forms the smallest allowable DNS response to a query.

contains.name: name
description: Relative name of the resource in BIG-IP.

contains.name: persist_cidr_ipv4
description: Specifies the number of bits the system uses to identify IPv4 addresses when persistence is enabled.

contains.name: persist_cidr_ipv6
description: Specifies the number of bits the system uses to identify IPv6 addresses when persistence is enabled.

contains.name: pool_lb_mode
description: Specifies the load balancing method used to select a pool in this wide IP.

contains.name: pools
description: Specifies the pools that this wide IP uses for load balancing.

contains.name: ttl_persistence
description: Specifies, in seconds, the length of time for which the persistence entry is valid.
GTM Wide IP related information.
Every "type" of wide-ip has the exact same list of possible information. Therefore, the list of information here is presented once instead of 6 times.
return.returned: When any of C(gtm-wide-ips) or C(gtm-*-wide-ips) is specified in C(gather_subset).

return.name: http_monitors

contains.name: adaptive
description: Whether adaptive response time monitoring is enabled for this monitor.

contains.name: adaptive_divergence_type
description: Specifies whether the adaptive-divergence-value is C(relative) or C(absolute).

contains.name: adaptive_divergence_value
description: Specifies how far from mean latency each monitor probe is allowed to be.

contains.name: adaptive_limit
description: Specifies the hard limit, in milliseconds, which the probe is not allowed to exceed, regardless of the divergence value.

contains.name: adaptive_sampling_timespan
description: Specifies the size of the sliding window, in seconds, which records probe history.

contains.name: description
description: Description of the resource.

contains.name: destination
description: Specifies the IP address and service port of the resource that is the destination of this monitor.

contains.name: full_path
description: Full name of the resource as known to BIG-IP.

contains.name: interval
description: Specifies, in seconds, the frequency at which the system issues the monitor check when either the resource is down or the status of the resource is unknown.

contains.name: ip_dscp
description: Specifies the differentiated services code point (DSCP).

contains.name: manual_resume
description: Specifies whether the system automatically changes the status of a resource to up at the next successful monitor check.

contains.name: name
description: Relative name of the resource in BIG-IP.

contains.name: parent
description: Profile from which this profile inherits settings.

contains.name: receive_disable_string
description: Specifies a text string that the monitor looks for in the returned resource. If the text string is matched in the returned resource, the corresponding node or pool member is marked session disabled.

contains.name: receive_string
description: Specifies the text string that the monitor looks for in the returned resource.

contains.name: reverse
description: Specifies whether the monitor operates in reverse mode. When the monitor is in reverse mode, a successful check marks the monitored object down instead of up.

contains.name: send_string
description: Specifies the text string that the monitor sends to the target object.

contains.name: time_until_up
description: Specifies the amount of time, in seconds, after the first successful response before a node is marked up.

contains.name: timeout

contains.name: accept_xff
description: Enables or disables trusting the client IP address, and statistics from the client IP address, based on the request's X-Forwarded-For (XFF) headers, if they exist.

When C(no), will silently drop the invalid HTTP.

contains.name: default_connect_handling
description: Specifies the behavior of the proxy service when handling outbound requests.

When C(reject), rejects the connection.

contains.name: excess_server_headers
description: Specifies the pass-through behavior when C(max_header_count) value is exceeded by the server.
When C(reject), rejects the connection.

contains.name: hsts_include_subdomains
description: When C(yes), applies the HSTS policy to the HSTS host and its subdomains.

contains.name: insert_x_forwarded_for
description: When C(yes), specifies that the system inserts an X-Forwarded-For header in an HTTP request with the client IP address, to use with connection pooling.

contains.name: known_methods
description: Optimizes the behavior of a known HTTP method in the list.
The default methods include the following HTTP/1.1 methods. CONNECT, DELETE, GET, HEAD, LOCK, OPTIONS, POST, PROPFIND, PUT, TRACE, UNLOCK.
If a known method is deleted from the C(known_methods) list, the BIG-IP system applies the C(unknown_method) setting to manage that traffic.

contains.name: lws_max_columns

contains.name: max_header_count
description: Specifies the maximum number of headers the system supports.

contains.name: max_header_size
description: Specifies the maximum size in bytes the system allows for all HTTP request headers combined, including the request line.

contains.name: max_requests
description: Specifies the number of requests that the system accepts on a per-connection basis.

contains.name: name
description: Relative name of the resource in BIG-IP.

contains.name: onconnect_transformations
description: When C(yes), specifies, that the system performs HTTP header transformations for the purpose of keeping connections open.

contains.name: oversize_client_headers
description: Specifies the pass-through behavior when the C(max_header_size) value is exceeded by the client.

contains.name: oversize_server_headers
description: Specifies the pass-through behavior when the C(max_header_size) value is exceeded by the server.

contains.name: pipeline_action

contains.name: proxy_mode
description: Specifies the proxy mode for this profile. Either reverse, explicit, or transparent.

contains.name: redirect_rewrite
description: Specifies whether the system rewrites the URIs that are part of HTTP redirect (3XX) responses

contains.name: request_chunking

contains.name: response_chunking

contains.name: server_agent_name
description: Specifies the string used as the server name in traffic generated by LTM.

contains.name: sflow_sampling_rate
description: Specifies the ratio of packets observed to the samples generated.

description: Specifies whether to Remove, Preserve, or Append Via headers included in an origin web server response to a client.

When C(idle), idle connections will be dropped as the TCP connection limit is reached.

contains.name: traffic_group
description: Traffic group the Self-IP is associated with.

contains.name: traffic_group_inherited
description: Whether or not the traffic group is inherited.

contains.name: vlan
description: VLAN associated with the Self-IP.

return.description: Self-IP related information.
return.returned: When C(self-ips) is specified in C(gather_subset).

return.name: server_ssl_profiles

contains.name: alert_timeout
description: Maximum time period in seconds to keep the SSL session active after alert message is sent, or indefinite.

contains.name: allow_expired_crl
description: Use the specified CRL file even if it has expired.

contains.name: authenticate_depth
description: The client certificate chain maximum traversal depth

contains.name: authenticate_name
description: Common Name (CN) that is embedded in a server certificate.
The system authenticates a server based on the specified CN.

contains.name: authentication_frequency
description: Specifies the frequency of authentication.

contains.name: bypass_on_client_cert_fail
description: Enables or disables SSL forward proxy bypass on failing to get client certificate that server asks for.

contains.name: bypass_on_handshake_alert
description: Enables or disables SSL forward proxy bypass on receiving handshake_failure, protocol_version or unsupported_extension alert message during the serverside SSL handshake.

contains.name: c3d_ca_cert
description: Name of the certificate file that is used as the certification authority certificate when SSL client certificate constrained delegation is enabled.

contains.name: c3d_ca_key
description: Name of the key file that is used as the certification authority key when SSL client certificate constrained delegation is enabled.

contains.name: c3d_cert_extension_includes
description: Extensions of the client certificates to be included in the generated certificates using SSL client certificate constrained delegation.

contains.name: c3d_cert_lifespan
description: Lifespan of the certificate generated using the SSL client certificate constrained delegation.

contains.name: ca_file
description: Certificate authority file name.

contains.name: cache_size
description: The SSL session cache size.

contains.name: cache_timeout
description: The SSL session cache timeout value, which is the usable lifetime seconds of negotiated SSL session IDs.

contains.name: cert
description: The name of the certificate installed on the traffic management system for the purpose of terminating or initiating an SSL connection.

contains.name: chain
description: Specifies or builds a certificate chain file that a client can use to authenticate the profile.

contains.name: cipher_group
description: Specifies a cipher group.

contains.name: ciphers
description: Specifies a cipher name.

contains.name: crl_file
description: Specifies the certificate revocation list file name.

contains.name: description
description: Description of the resource.

contains.name: expire_cert_response_control
description: Specifies the BIGIP action when the server certificate has expired.

contains.name: full_path
description: Full name of the resource as known to BIG-IP.

contains.name: generic_alert
description: Enables or disables generic-alert.

contains.name: handshake_timeout
description: Specifies the handshake timeout in seconds.

contains.name: key
description: Specifies the key file name. Specifies the name of the key installed on the traffic management system for the purpose of terminating or initiating an SSL connection.

contains.name: max_active_handshakes
description: Specifies the maximum number allowed SSL active handshakes.

contains.name: mod_ssl_methods
description: Enables or disables ModSSL methods.

contains.name: mode
description: Enables or disables SSL processing.

contains.name: name
description: Relative name of the resource in BIG-IP.

contains.name: ocsp
description: Specifies the name of ocsp profile for purpose of validating status of server certificate.

contains.name: options
description: Enables options, including some industry-related workarounds.

contains.name: parent
description: Profile from which this profile inherits settings.

contains.name: peer_cert_mode
description: Specifies the peer certificate mode.

contains.name: proxy_ssl
description: Allows further modification of application traffic within an SSL tunnel while still allowing the server to perform necessary authorization, authentication, auditing steps.

contains.name: proxy_ssl_passthrough
description: Allows Proxy SSL to passthrough the traffic when ciphersuite negotiated between the client and server is not supported.

contains.name: renegotiate_period
description: Number of seconds from the initial connect time after which the system renegotiates an SSL session.

contains.name: renegotiate_size
description: Specifies a throughput size, in megabytes, of SSL renegotiation.

contains.name: renegotiation
description: Whether renegotiations are enabled.

contains.name: retain_certificate
description: APM module requires storing certificate in SSL session. When C(no), certificate will not be stored in SSL session.

contains.name: secure_renegotiation
description: Specifies the secure renegotiation mode.

contains.name: server_name
description: Server name to be included in SNI (server name indication) extension during SSL handshake in ClientHello.

contains.name: session_mirroring
description: Enables or disables the mirroring of sessions to high availability peer.

contains.name: session_ticket
description: Enables or disables session-ticket.

contains.name: sni_default
description: When C(yes), this profile is the default SSL profile when the server name in a client connection does not match any configured server names, or a client connection does not specify any server name at all.

contains.name: sni_require
description: When C(yes), connections to a server that does not support SNI extension will be rejected.

contains.name: ssl_c3d
description: Enables or disables SSL Client certificate constrained delegation.

contains.name: ssl_forward_proxy_bypass
description: Enables or disables ssl-forward-proxy-bypass feature.

contains.name: ssl_forward_proxy_enabled
description: Enables or disables ssl-forward-proxy feature.

contains.name: ssl_sign_hash
description: Specifies SSL sign hash algorithm which is used to sign and verify SSL Server Key Exchange and Certificate Verify messages for the specified SSL profiles.

contains.name: strict_resume
description: Enables or disables the resumption of SSL sessions after an unclean shutdown.

contains.name: unclean_shutdown
description: Specifies, when C(yes), that the SSL profile performs unclean shutdowns of all SSL connections, which means that underlying TCP connections are closed without exchanging the required SSL shutdown alerts.

contains.name: untrusted_cert_response_control
description: Specifies the BIGIP action when the server certificate has untrusted CA.

return.description: Server SSL related information.
return.returned: When C(server-ssl-profiles) is specified in C(gather_subset).

return.name: software_hotfixes

contains.name: build
description: Build number of the image.
This is usually a sub-string of the C(name).

contains.name: checksum
description: MD5 checksum of the image.
Note that this is the checksum that is stored inside the ISO. It is not the actual checksum of the ISO.

contains.name: full_path
description: Full name of the resource as known to BIG-IP.

contains.name: id
description: ID component of the image.
This is usually a sub-string of the C(name).

contains.name: name
description: Name of the image.

contains.name: product
description: Product contained in the ISO.

contains.name: title
description: Human friendly name of the image.

contains.name: verified
description: Whether or not the system has verified this image.

contains.name: version
description: Version of software contained in the image.
This is a sub-string of the C(name).

return.description: List of software hotfixes.
return.returned: When C(software-hotfixes) is specified in C(gather_subset).

return.name: software_images

contains.name: build
description: Build number of the image.
This is usually a sub-string of the C(name).

contains.name: build_date
description: Date of the build.

contains.name: checksum
description: MD5 checksum of the image.
Note that this is the checksum that is stored inside the ISO. It is not the actual checksum of the ISO.

contains.name: file_size
description: Size, in megabytes, of the image.

contains.name: full_path
description: Full name of the resource as known to BIG-IP.

contains.name: last_modified
description: Last modified date of the ISO.

contains.name: name
description: Name of the image.

contains.name: product
description: Product contained in the ISO.

contains.name: verified
description: Whether or not the system has verified this image.

contains.name: version
description: Version of software contained in the image.
This is a sub-string of the C(name).

return.description: List of software images.

return.name: software_volumes

contains.name: active
description: Whether the volume is currently active or not.
An active volume contains the currently running version of software.

contains.name: base_build
description: Base build version of the software installed in the volume.
When a hotfix is installed, this refers to the base version of software that the hotfix requires.

contains.name: build
description: Build version of the software installed in the volume.

contains.name: default_boot_location
description: Whether this volume is the default boot location or not.

contains.name: full_path
description: Full name of the resource as known to BIG-IP.

contains.name: name
description: Relative name of the resource in BIG-IP.
This usually matches the C(full_name).

contains.name: product
description: The F5 product installed in this slot.
This should always be BIG-IP.

contains.name: status
description: Status of the software installed, or being installed, in the volume.
When C(complete), indicates that the software has completed installing.

contains.name: version
description: Version of software installed in the volume, excluding the C(build) number.

return.description: List of software volumes.
return.returned: When C(software-volumes) is specified in C(gather_subset).

return.name: ssl_certs

contains.name: create_time
description: Specifies the time at which the file-object was created.

contains.name: expiration_date
description: Specifies a string representation of the expiration date of the certificate.

contains.name: expiration_timestamp
description: Specifies the date at which this certificate expires. Stored as a POSIX time.

contains.name: fingerprint
description: Displays the SHA-256 fingerprint of the certificate.

contains.name: full_path
description: Full name of the resource as known to BIG-IP.

contains.name: is_bundle
description: Specifies whether the certificate file is a bundle (that is, whether it contains more than one certificate).

contains.name: issuer
description: Specifies X509 information of the certificate's issuer.

contains.name: key_size
description: Specifies the size (in bytes) of the file associated with this file object.

contains.name: key_type
description: Specifies the type of cryptographic key associated with this certificate.

contains.name: last_update_time
description: Specifies the last time at which the file-object was updated/modified.

contains.name: name
description: Relative name of the resource in BIG-IP.

contains.name: sha1_checksum
description: SHA1 checksum of the certificate.

contains.name: subject
description: Specifies X509 information of the certificate's subject.

contains.name: system_path
description: Path on the BIG-IP where the cert can be found.

return.description: SSL certificate related information.
return.returned: When C(ssl-certs) is specified in C(gather_subset).

return.name: ssl_keys

contains.name: full_path
description: Full name of the resource as known to BIG-IP.

contains.name: key_size
description: Specifies the size of the cryptographic key associated with this file object, in bits.

contains.name: key_type
description: Specifies the cryptographic type of the key in question. That is, which algorithm this key is compatible with.

contains.name: name
description: Relative name of the resource in BIG-IP.

contains.name: security_type
description: Specifies the type of security used to handle or store the key.

contains.name: sha1_checksum
description: The SHA1 checksum of the key.

contains.name: system_path
description: The path on the filesystem where the key is stored.

return.description: SSL certificate related information.
return.returned: When C(ssl-certs) is specified in C(gather_subset).

contains.name: scf_config

contains.name: value

contains.name: full_path
description: Full name of the resource as known to BIG-IP.

contains.name: interval
description: Specifies, in seconds, the frequency at which the system issues the monitor check when either the resource is down or the status of the resource is unknown.

contains.name: manual_resume
description: Specifies whether the system automatically changes the status of a resource to up at the next successful monitor check.

contains.name: time_until_up
description: Specifies the amount of time, in seconds, after the first successful response before a node is marked up.

contains.name: transparent
description: Specifies whether the monitor operates in transparent mode.

contains.name: up_interval
description: Specifies, in seconds, the frequency at which the system issues the monitor check when the resource is up.

return.name: tcp_monitors

contains.name: adaptive
description: Whether adaptive response time monitoring is enabled for this monitor.

contains.name: adaptive_divergence_type
description: Specifies whether the adaptive-divergence-value is C(relative) or C(absolute).

contains.name: adaptive_divergence_value
description: Specifies how far from mean latency each monitor probe is allowed to be.

contains.name: adaptive_limit
description: Specifies the hard limit, in milliseconds, which the probe is not allowed to exceed, regardless of the divergence value.

contains.name: adaptive_sampling_timespan
description: Specifies the size of the sliding window, in seconds, which records probe history.

contains.name: description
description: Description of the resource.

contains.name: destination
description: Specifies the IP address and service port of the resource that is the destination of this monitor.

contains.name: full_path
description: Full name of the resource as known to BIG-IP.

contains.name: interval
description: Specifies, in seconds, the frequency at which the system issues the monitor check when either the resource is down or the status of the resource is unknown.

contains.name: ip_dscp
description: Specifies the differentiated services code point (DSCP).

contains.name: manual_resume
description: Specifies whether the system automatically changes the status of a resource to up at the next successful monitor check.

contains.name: name
description: Relative name of the resource in BIG-IP.

contains.name: parent
description: Profile from which this profile inherits settings.

contains.name: reverse
description: Specifies whether the monitor operates in reverse mode. When the monitor is in reverse mode, a successful check marks the monitored object down instead of up.

contains.name: time_until_up
description: Specifies the amount of time, in seconds, after the first successful response before a node is marked up.

contains.name: timeout
description: Specifies the number of seconds the target has in which to respond to the monitor request.

contains.name: transparent
description: Specifies whether the monitor operates in transparent mode.

contains.name: up_interval
description: Specifies, in seconds, the frequency at which the system issues the monitor check when the resource is up.

return.description: TCP monitor related information.
return.returned: When C(tcp-monitors) is specified in C(gather_subset).

return.name: tcp_profiles

contains.name: abc
description: Appropriate Byte Counting (RFC 3465)
When C(yes), increases the congestion window by basing the increase amount on the number of previously unacknowledged bytes that each ACK covers.

contains.name: ack_on_push
description: Specifies, when C(yes), significantly improved performance to Microsoft Windows and MacOS peers who are writing out on a very small send buffer.

contains.name: auto_proxy_buffer
description: Specifies, C(yes), that the system uses the network measurements to set the optimal proxy buffer size.

contains.name: auto_receive_window
description: Specifies, when C(yes), that the system uses the network measurements to set the optimal receive window size.

contains.name: auto_send_buffer
description: Specifies, when C(yes), that the system uses the network measurements to set the optimal send buffer size.

contains.name: close_wait
description: Specifies the length of time that a TCP connection remains in the LAST-ACK state before quitting.
In addition to a numeric value, the value of this fact may also be one of C(immediate) or C(indefinite).
When C(immediate), specifies that the TCP connection closes immediately after entering the LAST-ACK state.
When C(indefinite), specifies that TCP connections in the LAST-ACK state do not close until they meet the maximum retransmissions timeout.

contains.name: congestion_control
description: Specifies the algorithm to use to share network resources among competing users to reduce congestion.
Return values may include, C(high-speed), C(cdg), C(chd), C(none), C(cubic), C(illinois), C(new-reno), C(reno), C(scalable), C(vegas), C(westwood), and C(woodside).

contains.name: congestion_metrics_cache
description: Specifies, when C(yes), that the system uses a cache for storing congestion metrics.
Subsequently, because these metrics are already known and cached, the initial slow-start ramp for previously-encountered peers improves.

contains.name: congestion_metrics_cache_timeout
description: Specifies the number of seconds for which entries in the congestion metrics cache are valid.

contains.name: deferred_accept
description: Specifies, when C(yes), that the system defers allocation of the connection chain context until the system has received the payload from the client.
Enabling this setting is useful in dealing with 3-way handshake denial-of-service attacks.

contains.name: delay_window_control
description: Specifies that the system uses an estimate of queuing delay as a measure of congestion to control, in addition to the normal loss-based control, the amount of data sent.

contains.name: delayed_acks
description: Specifies, when checked (enabled), that the system can send fewer than one ACK (acknowledgment) segment per data segment received.

contains.name: description
description: Description of the resource.

contains.name: dont_fragment_flag
description: Specifies the Don't Fragment (DF) bit setting in the IP Header of the outgoing TCP packet.

contains.name: dsack
description: D-SACK (RFC 2883)
Specifies, when C(yes), the use of the selective ACK (SACK) option to acknowledge duplicate segments.

contains.name: early_retransmit
description: Specifies, when C(yes), that the system uses early retransmit (as specified in RFC 5827) to reduce the recovery time for connections that are receive- buffer or user-data limited.

contains.name: enhanced_loss_recovery
description: Specifies whether the system uses enhanced loss recovery to recover from random packet losses more effectively.

contains.name: explicit_congestion_notification
description: Specifies, when C(yes), that the system uses the TCP flags CWR (congestion window reduction) and ECE (ECN-Echo) to notify its peer of congestion and congestion counter-measures.

contains.name: fast_open
description: Specifies, when C(yes), that the system supports TCP Fast Open, which reduces latency by allowing a client to include the first packet of data with the SYN

contains.name: fast_open_cookie_expiration
description: Specifies the number of seconds that a Fast Open Cookie delivered to a client is valid for SYN packets from that client.

contains.name: fin_wait_1
description: Specifies the length of time that a TCP connection is in the FIN-WAIT-1 or CLOSING state before quitting.

contains.name: fin_wait_2
description: Specifies the length of time that a TCP connection is in the FIN-WAIT-2 state before quitting.

contains.name: full_path
description: Full name of the resource as known to BIG-IP.

contains.name: idle_timeout
description: Specifies the length of time that a connection is idle (has no traffic) before the connection is eligible for deletion.

contains.name: initial_congestion_window_size
description: Specifies the initial congestion window size for connections to this destination.

contains.name: initial_receive_window_size
description: Specifies the initial receive window size for connections to this destination.

contains.name: ip_tos
description: Specifies the L3 Type of Service (ToS) level that the system inserts in TCP packets destined for clients.

contains.name: keep_alive_interval
description: Specifies how frequently the system sends data over an idle TCP connection, to determine whether the connection is still valid.

contains.name: limited_transmit_recovery
description: Specifies, when C(yes), that the system uses limited transmit recovery revisions for fast retransmits (as specified in RFC 3042) to reduce the recovery time for connections on a lossy network.

contains.name: link_qos
description: Specifies the L2 Quality of Service (QoS) level that the system inserts in TCP packets destined for clients.

contains.name: max_segment_retrans
description: Specifies the maximum number of times that the system resends data segments.

contains.name: max_segment_size
description: Specifies the largest amount of data that the system can receive in a single TCP segment, not including the TCP and IP headers.

contains.name: max_syn_retrans
description: Specifies the maximum number of times that the system resends a SYN packet when it does not receive a corresponding SYN-ACK.

contains.name: md5_signature
description: Specifies, when C(yes), to use RFC2385 TCP-MD5 signatures to protect TCP traffic against intermediate tampering.

contains.name: minimum_rto
description: Specifies the minimum length of time the system waits for acknowledgements of data sent before resending the data.

contains.name: mptcp_checksum
description: Specifies, when C(yes), that the system calculates the checksum for MPTCP connections.

contains.name: mptcp_checksum_verify
description: Specifies, when C(yes), that the system verifies the checksum for MPTCP connections.

contains.name: mptcp_fallback
description: Specifies an action on fallback, that is, when MPTCP transitions to regular TCP, because something prevents MPTCP from working correctly.

contains.name: mptcp_fast_join
description: Specifies, when C(yes), a FAST join, allowing data to be sent on the MP_JOIN_SYN, which can allow a server response to occur in parallel with the JOIN.

contains.name: mptcp_idle_timeout
description: Specifies the number of seconds that an MPTCP connection is idle before the connection is eligible for deletion.

contains.name: mptcp_join_max
description: Specifies the highest number of MPTCP connections that can join to a given connection.

contains.name: mptcp_make_after_break
description: Specifies that make-after-break functionality is supported, allowing for long-lived MPTCP sessions.

contains.name: mptcp_no_join_dss_ack
description: Specifies, when checked (enabled), that no DSS option is sent on the JOIN ACK.

contains.name: mptcp_retransmit_min
description: Specifies the minimum value (in msec) of the retransmission timer for these MPTCP flows.

contains.name: mptcp_rto_max
description: Specifies the number of RTOs (retransmission timeouts) before declaring the subflow dead.

contains.name: mptcp_subflow_max
description: Specifies the maximum number of MPTCP subflows for a single flow.

contains.name: mptcp_timeout
description: Specifies, in seconds, the timeout value to discard long-lived sessions that do not have an active flow.

contains.name: multipath_tcp
description: Specifies, when C(yes), that the system accepts Multipath TCP (MPTCP) connections, which allow multiple client-side flows to connect to a single server-side flow.

contains.name: nagle_algorithm
description: Specifies whether the system applies Nagle's algorithm to reduce the number of short segments on the network.

contains.name: name
description: Relative name of the resource in BIG-IP.

contains.name: parent
description: Profile from which this profile inherits settings.

contains.name: pkt_loss_ignore_burst
description: Specifies the probability of performing congestion control when multiple packets are lost, even if the Packet Loss Ignore Rate was not exceeded.

contains.name: pkt_loss_ignore_rate
description: Specifies the threshold of packets lost per million at which the system performs congestion control.

contains.name: proxy_buffer_high
description: Specifies the proxy buffer level, in bytes, at which the receive window is closed.

contains.name: proxy_buffer_low
description: Specifies the proxy buffer level, in bytes, at which the receive window is opened.

contains.name: proxy_max_segment
description: Specifies, when C(yes), that the system attempts to advertise the same maximum segment size (MSS) to the server-side connection as that of the client-side connection.

contains.name: proxy_options
description: Specifies, when C(yes), that the system advertises an option (such as time stamps) to the server only when the option is negotiated with the client.

contains.name: push_flag
description: Specifies how the BIG-IP system receives ACKs.

contains.name: rate_pace
description: Specifies, when C(yes), that the system paces the egress packets to avoid dropping packets, allowing for optimum goodput.

contains.name: rate_pace_max_rate
description: Specifies the maximum rate in bytes per second to which the system paces TCP data transmission.

contains.name: receive_window
description: Specifies the maximum advertised RECEIVE window size.

contains.name: reset_on_timeout
description: Specifies, when C(yes), that the system sends a reset packet (RST) in addition to deleting the connection, when a connection exceeds the idle timeout value.

contains.name: retransmit_threshold
description: Specifies the number of duplicate ACKs (retransmit threshold) to start fast recovery.

contains.name: selective_acks
description: Specifies, when C(yes), that the system processes data using selective ACKs (SACKs) whenever possible, to improve system performance.

contains.name: selective_nack
description: Specifies, when C(yes), that the system processes data using a selective negative acknowledgment (SNACK) whenever possible, to improve system performance.

contains.name: send_buffer
description: Specifies the SEND window size.

contains.name: slow_start
description: Specifies, when C(yes), that the system uses Slow-Start Congestion Avoidance as described in RFC3390 in order to ramp up traffic without causing excessive congestion on the link.

contains.name: syn_cookie_enable
description: Specifies the default (if no DoS profile is associated) number of embryonic connections that are allowed on any virtual server, before SYN Cookie challenges are enabled for that virtual server.

contains.name: syn_cookie_white_list
description: Specifies whether or not to use a SYN Cookie WhiteList when doing software SYN Cookies.

contains.name: syn_retrans_to_base
description: Specifies the initial RTO (Retransmission TimeOut) base multiplier for SYN retransmissions.

contains.name: tail_loss_probe
description: Specifies, when C(yes), that the system uses Tail Loss Probe to reduce the number of retransmission timeouts.

description: Specifies the outgoing packet's IP Header TTL value for IPv4 traffic.

contains.name: time_to_live_v6
description: Specifies the outgoing packet's IP Header TTL value for IPv6 traffic.

contains.name: time_wait
description: Specifies the length of time that a TCP connection remains in the TIME-WAIT state before entering the CLOSED state.

contains.name: time_wait_recycle
description: Specifies, when C(yes), that connections in a TIME-WAIT state are reused when the system receives a SYN packet, indicating a request for a new connection.

contains.name: timestamps
description: Specifies, when C(yes), that the system uses the timestamps extension for TCP (as specified in RFC 1323) to enhance high-speed network performance.

contains.name: verified_accept
description: Specifies, when C(yes), that the system can actually communicate with the server before establishing a client connection.

contains.name: zero_window_timeout
description: Specifies the timeout in milliseconds for terminating a connection with an effective zero length TCP transmit window.

contains.name: idle_timeout
description: Number of seconds that a connection is idle before the connection is eligible for deletion.
In addition to a number, may be one of the values C(indefinite), or C(immediate).

contains.name: ip_df_mode
description: Describes the Don't Fragment (DF) bit setting in the outgoing UDP packet.
May be one of C(pmtu), C(preserve), C(set), or C(clear).
When C(pmtu), sets the outgoing UDP packet DF big based on the ip pmtu setting.
When C(preserve), preserves the incoming UDP packet Don't Fragment bit.
When C(set), sets the outgoing UDP packet DF bit.
When C(clear), clears the outgoing UDP packet DF bit.

contains.name: ip_tos_to_client
description: The Type of Service level that the traffic management system assigns to UDP packets when sending them to clients.
May be numeric, or the values C(pass-through) or C(mimic).

contains.name: ip_ttl_mode
description: The outgoing UDP packet's TTL mode.
Valid modes are C(proxy), C(preserve), C(decrement), and C(set).
When C(proxy), set the IP TTL of ipv4 to the default value of 255 and ipv6 to the default value of 64.
When C(preserve), set the IP TTL to the original packet TTL value.
When C(decrement), set the IP TTL to the original packet TTL value minus 1.
When C(set), set the IP TTL with the specified values in C(ip_ttl_v4) and C(ip_ttl_v6) values in the same profile.

contains.name: ip_ttl_v4
description: IPv4 TTL.

contains.name: ip_ttl_v6
description: IPv6 TTL.

contains.name: link_qos_to_client
description: The Quality of Service level that the system assigns to UDP packets when sending them to clients.
May be either numberic, or the value C(pass-through).

contains.name: name
description: Relative name of the resource in BIG-IP.

contains.name: no_checksum
description: Whether the checksum processing is enabled or disabled.
Note that if the datagram is IPv6, the system always performs checksum processing.

contains.name: parent
description: Profile from which this profile inherits settings.

contains.name: proxy_mss
description: When C(yes), specifies that the system advertises the same mss to the server as was negotiated with the client.
